widget.tooltip: Select whether the first day of the week should be Sunday or Monday (NOT IMPLEMENTED YET).
widget.help: In most cases, since you are going to use the Time Tracker for tracking staff hours, you probably want to use Monday or Thursday as the first day of the week. However, some people may find that offensive thinking that Sunday has to be the first day. This selection allows you to choose how to show the weeks to your users.

widget.tooltip: Select how the first week of the year is determined.

help.p: The First Sunday is used by most of the Americas, South Africa, China, Japan, Israel. The first week may be given number 0 instead of 1, representing a first week starting in the previous year.
ISO 8601 (First Thursday) is used by most of the European countries, most of Asian and Oceania. The first week may not start in the previous year.
The First Monday represents the day of the first week in the new year.
Unfortunately, strftime() does not currently support a first week day starting on a Friday so we do not support Islamic weeks properly. This is used throughout the Middle East.
